msContents.summary: The Pañcarakṣā corpus ("Five Protections") consists of the Mahāpratisarā, Mahāmāyūrī, Mahāsāhasrapramardanī, Mahāmantrānusāriṇī, and Mahāśītavatī. The earliest evidence for texts grouped together as the "Five Great Dhāraṇīs" comes from Tibetan catalogues around 800 CE, but this compendium is somewhat different from the surviving Sanskrit collection, which is preserved in manuscripts dating back to the eleventh century. These scriptures include spells, enumerations of benefits and ritual instructions for use. With the course of time all of them became deified and five related goddesses emerged. It is, however, important to note that the texts themselves do not have any references to these goddesses. (Zwalf 1985: 70). The script and the layout of this composite paper manuscript clearly points to the 17th century. The last folio is a later supply bearing the date 1682 CE, and it might not have been written much later than the date of production of the kernel; since there is every reason to believe that it is simply a fresh copy of leaf found to be damaged (Bendall 1883: 105), this might arguably be an instance of a copied date (and thus the manuscript might be dated 1682 CE). If this is the case, then this manuscript was written during the reign of Pārthivendramalla , who ruled in Kathmandu between 1680 and 1687.

msItem.title: Pañcarakṣā
msItem.rubric: [1v1, first codicological unit (kernel)] $ oṃ namo bhagavatyai āryamahāpratisarāyaiḥ ||
msItem.incipit: [1v2, first codicological unit (kernel)] lokārthasirddhiparamaṃ bahuratvacitraṃ sarddharmakośam asamaṃ śravaṇāyaṃ dhīrāḥ | āyāntv ataḥ muramahoragadaityaṃ saṃghāḥ pujāvidhānaniratā, garuḍā narendrāḥ || [1v2] āryam imāṃ pratisarāsmṛtimātranāthāṃ, rakṣāvidhāna%caturāṃ jagataḥ samamtrān_ | saṃvarṇṇītā stutiśataiś ca tathāgatais taiḥ sarvārtha%siddhinicayā praṇamāmi bhūyā, || @ || evam mayā śrutam eka[1v3]smin samaye bhagavān_ mahāvajrameruśikhare kūṭāgāre vi%harati sma || mahāvajrasamādhibhūmipratisthāne mahāvajrakalpavṛkṣe samalaṃ:%kṛte |
msItem.finalRubric: [31r3, first codicological unit (kernel)] || mahāpratisarāmahāvi%dyārajñīḥ rakṣāvidhānakalpo vidyādharasyāyaṃ samā[31r4]pta || ^^^ ||
[64v5, first codicological unit (kernel)] || ^^^ || āryamahāsāhasrapramardnī nāma mahāyānaṃ sūtraṃ samāptaḥ || ^^^ ||
[106v1, first codicological unit (kernel)] || % || āryamahāmāyūrī vidyārājñī avinaṣṭā yakṣamukh a ā [106v2]t pratilabdhā samāptā bhagavatī || @ ||
[109r1, first codicological unit (kernel)] || ^^^ || āryamahāśītavatī mahāvidyārajñī samāptā || @ ||
msItem.explicit: [113v4, first codicological unit (kernel)] svasti vo dvipade bhontu svasti vo stu catu¦[113v5]spade | svasti vo vrajatāṃ mārge svasti pratyāgateṣu ca | svasti rātrau svasti divā svasti madhyandinasthite | sarvatra svasti vo bhontu mā kā caiṣā pāpam āgamat_ | sarve satvāḥ sarve prāṇāḥ sarve bhūtāś ca kevalāḥ | sarve vai

[114r1, second codicological unit] sukhinor abhavamtu, ṇirātmayāḥ | sarve bhadrāni paśyantu, mā kañci kham pāpam āgataḥ jāṇīha bhūtāni samāgatānī sthitāni bhūmāṃv artham āṃtarīkṣa, kuru[114r2]vaṃmtu maitri satataḥ prajāsu divā, ca rā%trau cañcalaṃ tu dharmaṃ || @|| iti tatra buddhānāṃ, m buddhā%nūbhāvena, devatānāṃ devatānubhāve, sā[114r3]tiṃ ca postiṃñ ca-3- tvānāṃ ca rakṣa rakṣa sāṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā || @ ||
msItem.finalRubric: [114r3, second codicological unit] āryyamahāmantrāṇusāra%ni māhāvidyārāgi samāpta || ^^^ ||
[114r3, second codicological unit] [114r4] āryyamāhāpratisarā, āryyamāhāsāhasrapramardani, āryyamāhāmāyuri, āryyamāhāśitapati, āryyamāhāmantrānuśāraṇi, etāṇi paṃñca mā[114v1]hārakṣāśutrāni samāpta ||
msItem.colophon: [114v1, second codicological unit] ye dharmmā hettuprabhāvā, hettu teṣāṃ -1-tathāga tūḥ jo nirodha yavatavādi māhāśranamanaṃ || ^^^ || svastu saṃmvat_ 802 māhārājaddhi[114v2]rājacakracūḍāmaṇiśrīśrīśrīpāthivṛṃ¦%ndramalladeva, mayūracchatra, kharṅgaśīrddhikāmanāthaṃ, nṛpa%tithākūradharmmācakravijayarajya

physDesc.p: Composite manuscript consisting of two codicological units. The second, dependent codicological unit consists of one paper folio of the same dimension of the rest of manuscript, and added at the end of the manuscript, containing the end of the text and the colophon.

supportDesc.extent: 111 ff. (folios 17, 29, 92, 104 are missing. Two folios are numbered 39).
supportDesc.condition: Complete, in generally good condition (many folios are slightly worn out).

bindingDesc.p: Wood cover, original binding. The back cover is wrapped in what seems to be a bundle of strings for manuscripts.
bindingDesc.stringHole: Two string holes (now bolted in the front cover).

history.origin: 17th century (see the second codicological unit). Nepāl, Kathmandu.
history.provenance: Bought by Wright, Daniel Dr. D. Wright on behalf of the Cambridge University Library in 1875.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card for admissions procedures contact Cambridge University Library Admissions).

layout.p: 5 lines per page, approximately 72 akṣaras per line.

handDesc.p: Possibly more than one hand for the main text.

handNote.desc: First hand: Nepālākṣarā in black ink (Main text).
Second hand: Nepālākṣarā in black ink (Marginal corrections and annotations).

list.item: On the recto of the first folio, an invocation in Rañjanā: oṃ namo buddhāyaḥ ||.

item.marginalia: Many marginal corrections throughout the manuscript.
